verses.kjv: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which was a Jewess, and believed; but his father was a Greek:
verses.ct: Paul arrived at Derbe and then Lystra, where there was a disciple named Timothy. His mother was a Jewish believer, but his father was Greek.

verses.kjv: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.
verses.ct: The brothers in Lystra and Iconium spoke highly of Timothy.

verses.kjv: Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.
verses.ct: Paul wanted Timothy to travel with him, so he had him circumcised because of the Jewish people living in that area, since everyone knew his father was Greek.

verses.kjv: And as they went through the cities, they delivered them the decrees for to keep, that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: As they traveled from city to city, they passed along the decisions that the apostles and elders in Jerusalem had made, instructing the believers to follow them.

verses.kjv: And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.
verses.ct: So the churches grew stronger in their faith and increased in number every day.

verses.kjv: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,
verses.ct: They traveled through the regions of Phrygia and Galatia, because the Holy Spirit had prevented them from speaking the message in Asia.

verses.kjv: After they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.
verses.ct: When they reached the border of Mysia, they tried to enter Bithynia, but the Spirit did not allow them to go there either.

verses.kjv: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.
verses.ct: So they passed through Mysia and went down to Troas.

verses.kjv: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night; There stood a man of Macedonia, and prayed him, saying, Come over into Macedonia, and help us.
verses.ct: During the night, Paul had a vision: a man from Macedonia was standing there, pleading with him, "Cross over to Macedonia and help us!"

verses.kjv: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavoured to go into Macedonia, assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them.
verses.ct: As soon as Paul saw this vision, we immediately made plans to leave for Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to share the good news with the people there.

verses.kjv: Therefore loosing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the next day to Neapolis;
verses.ct: We set sail from Troas and went straight to Samothrace, and the following day we reached Neapolis.

verses.kjv: And from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia, and a colony: and we were in that city abiding certain days.
verses.ct: From there we traveled to Philippi, which is a leading city in that district of Macedonia and a Roman colony. We stayed in that city for several days.

verses.kjv: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side, where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the women which resorted thither.
verses.ct: On the Sabbath, we went outside the city gate to a spot along the river where we expected people would gather for prayer. We sat down and began talking with the women who had come together there.

verses.kjv: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, which worshipped God, heard us: whose heart the Lord opened, that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul.
verses.ct: One of those listening was a woman named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira, who was devoted to God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to what Paul was saying.

verses.kjv: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying, If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and abide there. And she constrained us.
verses.ct: After she and everyone in her household were baptized, she urged us, "If you consider me a genuine believer in the Lord, please come and stay at my home." She kept insisting until we agreed.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying:
verses.ct: One day as we were heading to the place of prayer, we were met by a slave girl who had a spirit that enabled her to predict the future. She earned a lot of money for her owners through fortune-telling.

verses.kjv: The same followed Paul and us, and cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation.
verses.ct: She followed Paul and the rest of us around, shouting, "These men are servants of the Most High God! They are telling you the way of salvation!"

verses.kjv: And this did she many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her. And he came out the same hour.
verses.ct: She kept doing this for many days. Finally Paul became so troubled that he turned and spoke to the spirit: "In the name of Jesus Christ, I order you to come out of her." The spirit left her that very moment.

verses.kjv: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Paul and Silas, and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers,
verses.ct: When her owners realized their source of income was gone, they grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them to the marketplace to face the authorities.

verses.kjv: And brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,
verses.ct: They brought them before the magistrates and said, "These men are Jews, and they are causing serious trouble in our city.

verses.kjv: And teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans.
verses.ct: They are promoting practices that are illegal for us as Roman citizens to accept or follow."

verses.kjv: And the multitude rose up together against them: and the magistrates rent off their clothes, and commanded to beat them.
verses.ct: The crowd joined in the attack against them, and the magistrates had their clothes torn off and ordered them to be beaten with rods.

verses.kjv: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:
verses.ct: After they had been severely beaten, they were thrown into prison, and the jailer was given strict orders to guard them carefully.

verses.kjv: Who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and made their feet fast in the stocks.
verses.ct: Following these instructions, he put them in the innermost cell and locked their feet in wooden stocks.

verses.kjv: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.
verses.ct: Around midnight, Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them.

verses.kjv: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken: and immediately all the doors were opened, and every one’s bands were loosed.
verses.ct: Suddenly a massive earthquake shook the prison to its foundations. Instantly, every door flew open and everyone's chains came loose.

verses.kjv: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, and seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his sword, and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.
verses.ct: The jailer woke up and saw that the prison doors were wide open. He drew his sword and was about to kill himself, assuming the prisoners had escaped.

verses.kjv: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.
verses.ct: But Paul shouted, "Don't hurt yourself! We are all still here!"

verses.kjv: Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas,
verses.ct: The jailer called for torches, rushed in, and dropped to his knees in front of Paul and Silas, trembling with fear.

verses.kjv: And brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?
verses.ct: Then he brought them outside and asked, "Sirs, what do I need to do to be saved?"

verses.kjv: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
verses.ct: They answered, "Put your faith in the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved — you and your household."

verses.kjv: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.
verses.ct: Then they shared the message of the Lord with him and everyone in his home.

verses.kjv: And he took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes; and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.
verses.ct: Even at that late hour of the night, the jailer took them and washed their wounds. Right away, he and his entire family were baptized.

verses.kjv: And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.
verses.ct: He brought them into his house and served them a meal. He and his whole household were filled with joy because they had come to believe in God.

verses.kjv: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying, Let those men go.
verses.ct: When morning came, the magistrates sent their officers with the message, "Release those men."

verses.kjv: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul, The magistrates have sent to let you go: now therefore depart, and go in peace.
verses.ct: The jailer reported this to Paul: "The magistrates have sent word to release you. So you can leave now and go in peace."

verses.kjv: But Paul said unto them, They have beaten us openly uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselves and fetch us out.
verses.ct: But Paul responded, "They had us publicly beaten without a trial, even though we are Roman citizens, and threw us in prison. Now they want to get rid of us quietly? Absolutely not! Let them come personally and escort us out."

verses.kjv: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates: and they feared, when they heard that they were Romans.
verses.ct: The officers reported this back to the magistrates, who became alarmed when they learned that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens.

verses.kjv: And they came and besought them, and brought them out, and desired them to depart out of the city.
verses.ct: The magistrates came and apologized to them. They escorted them out and asked them to please leave the city.

verses.kjv: And they went out of the prison, and entered into the house of Lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them, and departed.
verses.ct: After leaving the prison, Paul and Silas went to Lydia's house. There they met with the brothers and sisters, encouraged them, and then departed.
